fields.description:
I tried bumping UPM to support FishEye/Crucible 2.7 from 2.6.1, and some integration tests involving {{@RequiresRestart}} started failing. Everything worked in FishEye/Crucible 2.6.1.

Note that this only happens when I'm installing a new plugin with a module that requires restart. But it works as expected when "upgrading" a plugin (i.e., {{@RequiresRestart}} is honored).

This issue is caused by a bug in the Plugin Framework.  Filed as [PLUG-839|https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/PLUG-839].  I've confirmed it in both Atlassian Plugins 2.7.6 and 2.8.0, so I'm expecting (but haven't tested) that this bug appears in FishEye/Crucible 2.6.2 as well.
fields.summary: FishEye/Crucible does not respect @RequiresRestart annotation

fields.description:
The {{withWriter()}} method in {{LuceneConnection}} acquires the writeLock and indexWriter outside of the try finally that ensures the writeLock is released.


This causes a hang when getIndexWriter throws a DbException, because the writeLock is not released.

See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-3348

Was introduced as part of a debugging effort here: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE-hg/src/java/com/cenqua/fisheye/lucene/LuceneConnection.java?r2=ea46e998cf0eb7c1c1b042f50a3882fc6b1498e7&r1=21058001e93fc0046a964fce4a459a583d6904a5
fields.summary: lock mismanagement in LuceneConnection

fields.description:
I see the LOC numbers come up in fish eye and can't help comparing my productivity against the others.  I'm quite familiar with the issues of 
LOC, but it's still interesting. There are a few issues that make it
of much more questionable value in our group however. The metric counts too much and blows the numbers out of the water for some of us. 

- adding a way to limit LOC to just .java files would help eliminate noisy and very larget data files would help keep checkins of that type of file from making it look like someone is on performance enhancing drugs checking in 100,000 lines over a weekend. I might implement this as a filter that could by directory or file type. You never know when someone is doing something similar, but doing it in java files.

- In a way that may be more valuable to people that don't check in large amounts of test or resource data, having the LOC counter not count the creation of a branch would help as well. If you happen to be the guy who created a branch, you get "points" for all 100k LOC or so. It's a trivial operation that throws metrics way off.
fields.summary: Add usability to LOC reports

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm using IE8 (not in compatibility mode), and I've configured a brand-new FishEye instance, with a very small repository, and now I'm trying to add a user.

When I click on the "Add User" button, nothing happens. I'm not redirected to the "Add New User" page.

As a workaround, if I enter the URL http://localhost:8060/admin/userAdd-default.do directly in the browser and hit "Enter", I can access the "Add New User" page.

This problem does not happen in other browsers. It's specific to IE8.
fields.summary: Unable to add users when using IE8

fields.description:
Currently, Fisheye relies on the VCS to tell what is the correct mime-type to be used for each file and each version of the file. If the mime-type defined in the file is not the correct one, special characters are show with a � (? in a diamond).

The latest version of the file can be easily modified to have the correct mime-type, however changing the older versions may not be trivial.

Fisheye could have an option to overwrite the old versions mime-types with a custom one.

The current workaround would be to change the each version of the file. The following tutorial shows how it could be done:
http://blog.philippheckel.com/2011/02/01/altering-old-svn-revisions-removing-confidental-data-from-subversion-repository/
fields.summary: Allow Fisheye to define the Repo files mime-types.

fields.description:
Hi

This is Luke from Korean partner, Goldpitcher.
We are reported with SVN 1.7 support issue from customer.

We already know that Fisheye 2.7.x does not support 1.7 until now.
But unfortunately, we found that neither for native svn client via javahl.

We recognized javahl 1.7 is much different from 1.6.x. For example, classpath was changed from org.tigris.subversion.javahl to org.apache.subverion.javahl in 1.7.1 javahl and SVNClientInterface class is not in 1.7.1 javahl.

We hope it is supported soon.

Cheers,
Luke

The native svn JavaHL 1.7 client fails with the following error:

{code}
[java] 2012-11-30 14:00:54,809 ERROR - Unable to initialise repository checkstyle due to com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException:Could not access svn://localhost/ : java.lang.NullPointerException
     [java] com.cenqua.fisheye.config.ConfigException: Could not access svn://localhost/ : java.lang.NullPointerException
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryTester.pingAndValidateAccess(SvnRepositoryTester.java:156)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryScanner.validateAccess(SvnRepositoryScanner.java:353)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryScanner.validateRepository(SvnRepositoryScanner.java:265)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryScanner.startRepository(BaseRepositoryScanner.java:430)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryScanner.doSlurpTransaction(BaseRepositoryScanner.java:217)

     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.BaseRepositoryEngine.doSlurp(BaseRepositoryEngine.java:92)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryEngine.slurp(RepositoryEngine.java:383)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.OneOffPingRequest.doRequest(OneOffPingRequest.java:28)

     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.ping.PingRequest.run(PingRequest.java:33)
     [java] 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
     [java] 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
     [java] 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
     [java] Caused by: com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.RepositoryClientException: java.lang.NullPointerException
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.executeNoThrottle(SvnThrottledClient.java:116)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.execute(SvnThrottledClient.java:95)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient.propertyGet(SvnThrottledClient.java:157)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnRepositoryTester.pingAndValidateAccess(SvnRepositoryTester.java:144)
     [java] 	... 15 more
     [java] Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
     [java] 	at java.lang.String.<init>(String.java:593)
     [java] 	at org.tigris.subversion.javahl.SVNClient.propertyGet(SVNClient.java:2113)
     [java] 	at com.cenqua.fisheye.svn.SvnThrottledClient$5.call(SvnThrottledClient.java:161)

To work-around this for now:

* use the SVNKit Java SVN implementation (on by default in FishEye)
* if you must use a native implementation (really need to understand exactly why you would) then use the JavaHL 1.6 version
* it is not possible currently to use a native svn 1.7 client library in FishEye
fields.summary: Need to support SVN 1.7 with Native Client via JavaHL

fields.description:
caching was being done in our javascript autocomplete library is based on _results_ rather than _queries_. So if you search for nothing (eg. clicked the drop down), the first 50 results would display. if any one of those matched your next query, it would not go back to the server, and in fact use a less restrictive regex than the server - a word boundary is not required before the search term.

fix: disable client side caching
fields.summary: autocomplete dropdowns give inconsistent and sometimes wrong results (results missing)

fields.description:
When we load the file tree we stop *after* we have loaded the directory which caused us to exceed our time limit -- the other directories are Ajax loaded if they are opened.

Some directories (e.g. tags) can be very large and are very rarely opened -- we should have a threshold above which we don't lazy load, even if we haven't exceeded the alloted time.
fields.summary: We should be lazier when we load large directories for the file tree

fields.description: A work around for this issue is to create an 'admin' group, and give it 'Can Read' Access to each of your repositories, then create an admin user and add them to this group. They will see your repositories in the 'Default Repository' dropdown.

fields.description:
Today, if you don't want to use Crucible (Crucible disabled, FishEye enabled), some menu options specific to Crucible are still visible, such as:
* {{Project Settings}}
* {{Ccurity Settings >> Permission Schemes}}

This may be confusing to customers that don't understand exactly what's the difference between repositories and projects.

For example, clicking on {{Project Settings >> Projects}} (and this is a Crucible related menu) leads to a page with a heading "Projects".
In this page, this message is displayed:
bq. A project is a set of customisable *FishEye* content.
Customers may think they're creating repositories there, when in fact they're creating Crucible projects.
fields.summary: Hide Crucible specific administration menu options when Crucible is disabled

fields.description:
The activity stream in Fisheye returns a 404 error when trying to access the Jira Activity Stream. The URL it is using retrieves activity when using 'http://<jira url>/plugins/servlet/streams', but returns 404 when '/local?<parameters>' are appended to it by Fisheye.

Current URL Fisheye uses is: http://<jira url>/plugins/servlet/streams/local?

I've found that appending the parameters on to 'http://<jira url>/activity?' retrieves the required data.

Is there a way to change the URL fisheye uses for retrieving the activity stream to the correct one I found above, or is there likely to be an issue with the configuration which can be resolved?
fields.summary: Jira Activity Stream Returns 404 Error

fields.description:

RSS feeds from FishEye use relative URLs instead of absolute (no FE base URL: href="/browse/..."). As a result, source, history and diff links are absolutely useless being open not in the original site context.

See the problem in action here: http://forums.openpilot.org/topic/7405-openpilot-ostxpid-module-merge-branch-next-into-ostxpid-module/

Unfortunately, the template is hard-coded in a tag file of source code, so no easy way to fix it ourselves.

fields.description:
The following tag will be created automatically when clicking on the update in the FishEye UI although there is no changes added:
{code}
<proxy-info proxy-host="" proxy-scheme=""/>
{code}

Steps to replicate:
# Make sure FishEye is accessible via https protocol
# Make sure the FishEye config.xml only have the following tag:
{code}
<proxy-info\>
{code}
# Start the FishEye server 
# Go to the server setting via _FishEye administrator >> Server >> Web server_
# Click on Edit setting
# Make sure the HTTP Bind is empty
# Click Update


With the following tag created with empty string:
{code}
<proxy-info proxy-host="" proxy-scheme=""/>
{code}

User will face the following bug:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-4697
fields.summary: Empty proxy-info information will be created in config.xml by updating the FishEye UI without editing it when http bind option is empty

fields.description:
In git it is possible to tag a commit that is on a branch, but then move or delete the branch head so that no branch references a descendent of the tag.

This can also happen as a result of converting from SVN when the svn repository has complex tags (see http://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.6/svn.branchmerge.tags.html#svn.branchmerge.tags.mkcomplex) or tags that are modified.
fields.summary: FishEye does not index git tags that are not referenced by a branch

fields.description:
FishEye does not, as of 2.7.x, support per-branch and per-tag write (push) / rewind (non-fast-forward push) / delete access controls on Git repositories. Gitolite and Gerrit support these access controls and while Gerrit implements them using its custom implementation of Git the (slightly less advanced) Gitolite implementation is based on repository hooks that work with the official version of Git - proving that it is possible to do this with reasonable effort.

Please add support for these access controls in a future version of FishEye as they would greatly improve the usefulness of the managed Git repositories in a corporate setting where e.g. integration and release branches may need to be tightly controlled and forking a repository for each developer may be undesirable due to the number of developers involved.
fields.summary: Support per-branch and per-tag push, rewind and delete access controls with managed Git repositories (a la gitolite)

fields.description:
Affects instances with LDAP integration only. Local users do not appear to be affected.

Steps to replicate:

1) Turn off Global anonymous permissions for Fisheye and Crucible.
2) Turn off anonymous read/write permissions via repository defaults for built-in groups.
3) Ensure the "All logged-in users" have "Can read" permission via the "Permissions" section under Repository management.
4) Add a LDAP filter in repository "Permissions" to restrict access to certain LDAP users/groups only.
5) Ensure the "Access by Built-in Groups ->Use repository defaults." checkbox is {{unchecked}}.
6) Log into Fisheye as a registered user.

The "Source" tab will not list the repository for which per-repository permission has been set.

Manually editing the permissions in {{config.xml}} does not help either.

It seems like the only workaround is to turn on global anonymous permissions.
fields.summary: Repository restrictions/permissions are not honored when global anonymous access is turned off

fields.description:
REST resources should ensure to replace any non-valid XML characters before JAXB marshalls the response sent to a client

When we try to marshall a Java object than contains these characters JAXB will generate invalid XML which then causes parsing exceptions in the client side. More details @ https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/FISH-532 

We should replace these characters with the Unicode replacement character *before* we marshall the object.

More info @ http://java.net/jira/browse/JAXB-614
fields.summary: Failed to parse FishEye response: An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0x1a) was found in the element content of the document.

fields.description:
Consider the following scenario

# Crucible/Fisheye licensed for 25 users
# JIRA User Synchronisation set up to synchronise on JIRA group 'fecru-users'
# 'fecru-users' currently contains 25 users
# Admin removes 3 users from 'fecru-users' and adds 3 different users to 'fecru-users'
# Crucible/Fisheye synchronises users

h5. Expected

Crucible/Fisheye removes the removed users and adds the new users

h5. Actual

Crucible/Fisheye first attempts to add new users, resulting in a failed synchronisation due to license restriction of 25 users.

h5. Workaround

# Remove "new" users from 'fecru-users'
# (Manually) sync users to Crucible/Fisheye
# Re-add "new" users to 'fecru-users'
# Crucible/Fisheye syncs users
fields.summary: JIRA User Sync fails to sync due to license constraint when removing and adding users

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a stored cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the FishEye user profile. Affected versions are all versions earlier than 2.5.5

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these:

* cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
* The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/gAjSEQ
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in a user's comment

fields.description:
As I was told by your support team in this ticket: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-7133?focusedCommentId=2101760&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-2101760
there is no way to disable users in fisheye.

It is very inconvenient when during some time serveral developers leaving and the new ones are coming. I have to remove old developers' users and lose information about their names, repository user mappings and avatars.

So, please, add feature to disable fisheye users.

fields.description: By design our autocomplete dropdowns show only the first 50 results (in most if not all cases). This has caused confusion, and even support cases when users don't realize this. We should add an indicator at the bottom of each dropdown when it is truncated. Something like: "Results truncated. Refine to see others" or "See more ___s".
fields.summary: Autocomplete dropdowns should indicate when results are truncated

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
* open the folder containing the repositories managed by FishEye (by default FISHEYE_INST/managed-repos)
* create a new empty Git repository and commit something to it:
{noformat}
git init test.git
echo test > test
git add test
git commit -m"test"
{noformat}
* in the FishEye Admin, create a managed Git repository with the name 'test'

--> No error is reported, and if you clone the repo locally, you can see it is not an empty Git repository ({{git log}} returns the commit generated above)

This can happen for example if an existing managed repo was removed from {{config.xml}} (the repo is not registered to FishEye but still exists on disk)
fields.summary: Git does not report an error when creating a managed repository over an existing one

fields.description:
During the user synchronisation, if there is any error while communicating with Crowd, an exception is thrown by the REST client. When that happens, it is interpreted as "Can't Authenticate", which means we return a null authToken, and remove the user from the user database.

Instead, we should just skip the user (don't make changes to their entry on the FishEye side), and move on to the next one.

1) Errors like:
{code}
2011-10-19 20:14:57,799 INFO  [quartzScheduler_Worker-0 ] fisheye.app UserSynchroniserJob-execute - Starting resynchronising users
2011-10-19 20:14:58,532 INFO  [quartzScheduler_Worker-0 ] fisheye.app DefaultUserManager-synchroniseUsers - resynchronising users with crowd
2011-10-19 20:14:59,269 ERROR [quartzScheduler_Worker-0 ] fisheye.app CrowdAuth-canAuthenticate - Unexpected exception when retrieving token for user 'USER_NAME'
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.OperationFailedException
	at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestCrowdClient.handleCommonExceptions(RestCrowdClient.java:1084)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestCrowdClient.authenticateSSOUserWithoutValidatingPassword(RestCrowdClient.java:830)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.canAuthenticate(CrowdAuth.java:278)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.access$500(CrowdAuth.java:54)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth$3.call(CrowdAuth.java:241)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth$3.call(CrowdAuth.java:235)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.withTimer(CrowdAuth.java:92)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.crowd.CrowdAuth.recreateAuth(CrowdAuth.java:235)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.DefaultUserManager.synchroniseUsers(DefaultUserManager.java:631)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:309)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:183)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:150)
	at com.googlecode.ehcache.annotations.interceptor.EhCacheInterceptor.invokeTriggersRemove(EhCacheInterceptor.java:191)
	at com.googlecode.ehcache.annotations.interceptor.EhCacheInterceptor.invoke(EhCacheInterceptor.java:90)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:172)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:202)
	at $Proxy25.synchroniseUsers(Unknown Source)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.user.UserSynchroniserJob.execute(UserSynchroniserJob.java:30)
	at org.quartz.core.JobRunShell.run(JobRunShell.java:195)
	at org.quartz.simpl.SimpleThreadPool$WorkerThread.run(SimpleThreadPool.java:520)
{code}

Once the error is fixed, in the next round of synchronization, if the exception goes away, we create a new, different user, which makes the original problem even harder to fix.
fields.summary: When synchronizing users with Crowd, do not deactivate users if the error is a communication problem

fields.description: When the zoom of the Internet Explorer is varied the details are distorted. See image attached.
fields.summary: Internet Explorer zoom creates distortions in UI

fields.description:
When a tag has modifications (either through actual commits to the tag folder or through migrations of folders above it (e.g., the repository is moved and Follow Base Moves is enabled, or the project is renamed, etc), the Branch selector will attempt to jump from:

repo/trunk/path/to/file.txt

to

repo/tags/theTag/path/to/file.txt/path/to/file.txt

This is because we are incorrectly identifying the full path as a tagRoot in BranchSelectorUtil.getPhysicalPathAtTag, then appending the logicalTail to it.
fields.summary: Modified tags fail in the branch selector

fields.description:
The Activity Stream needs to know the name of the default branch (e.g., trunk, main, master, default, etc).  In git, we don't necessarily know this upfront and may need to make a remote call "git remote show" (see GitContext.java:getMainBranchName and SpecificRepositorySearcher.java for context).
This means waiting as long as ~15s _per repository_ (seen in a support case) for a slow connection when you first hit an Activity Stream, and potentially every hour afterwards (since we only cache this for an hour).
fields.summary: Activity Stream UI sometimes slow in git - it makes calls to git remote show.

fields.description:
With large repositories the data that FishEye stores can get very large.
Can FishEye get an option to have the FishEye data pruned, e.g. delete all data which is older than 6 months?
fields.summary: Delete old FishEye data

fields.description:
We were unable to turn the repositories off since
the admin screen did not list them before they were done indexing.

We finally worked around it by setting the repositories to disabled in the
config.xml - then enabled them one at a time, set the starting revision to
a recent revision and ran a re-index.

It would be nice to have a way to turn off the repository index from the
UI without having to do all this.
fields.summary: Turn off the repository index from the UI

fields.description:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/Customising+Email+Notifications
bq. Template files for FishEye are stored in the FISHEYE_HOME/templates/ folder.

It should be documented that email templates can also be stored in FISHEYE_INST/templates/, and will override the one in FISHEYE_HOME/templates/
fields.summary: Email templates in FISHEYE_INST/templates/ override FISHEYE_HOME/templates/

fields.description:
Hey,
it would be nice to have a FishEye-Plugin or something, which is sending an email, when the last updatetime of a repository is some minutes/hours ago. So you notice fast that something is going wrong.

i.e: I had that case a few days ago, when I saw in the overview that the last update of one of our repositories was 52 days ago...
fields.summary: Repositoryupdatetime notification

fields.description:
Documentation on "How to subscribe to an RSS feed for a repository" would be helpful.

Our [release notes|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/FishEye+2.5+Release+Notes#FishEye25ReleaseNotes-RSSImprovements] mention that FishEye provides RSS feeds, but I don't see any docs describing how to go and subscribe to a repository (or any other use case).

When entering FishEye with the intention to subscribe to an RSS feed for a repository, it isn't obvious that you need to navigate to the Activity view of a repository to be able to see the RSS option in the Tools menu.
fields.summary: Provide documentation on how to subscribe to RSS feeds for a repository

fields.description:
The documentation of the REST API of managed repositories has some errors:
* it incorrectly says that the delete operation is synchronous
* it does not properly include the links to the {{/status/}} calls for the fork or delete operations
* it does not document the list operation (list of managed repositories)
fields.summary: Fix documentation of the managed repositories' REST API

fields.description: Just like the 'Start Revision', there are times where a 'Stop Revision' is also needed.  Basically we are trying to create an archived FishEye repo that is still running but doesn't scan outside the Start and stop revisions.  Right now it's a massive pain to continue to add excludes and try to manage the repo that way.
fields.summary: Add a 'Stop Revision' option to SVN FishEye repositories

fields.description:
A JS error caused by certain user names will cause the Allowed Review Participants field not to function (no dropdown appears when typing in the field).
We need to use a more strict escaping of the names.
fields.summary: Allowed Review Participants field doesn't work when some users are present

fields.description:
If 
* no 'Groups to synchronise' have been configured and 
* FishEye is configured to periodically synchronise users from Crowd and
* only limited groups have been granted access to FishEye in Crowd

the following errors are logged when synchronising:

{noformat}
2011-09-27 15:38:10,335 ERROR - Unexpected exception when retrieving token for user 'user.xyz'
com.atlassian.crowd.exception.ApplicationPermissionException: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?><error><reason>APPLICATION_ACCESS_DENIED</reason><message>User does not have access to application <FishEye></message></error>
	at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestExecutor$MethodExecutor.throwError(RestExecutor.java:414)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.integration.rest.service.RestExecutor$MethodExecutor.andReceive(RestExecutor.java:300)

	at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor165.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:309)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:183)

fields.description:
After upgrading to 2.7.4, the following messages appear in the log for all repositories at startup:

Repository index does not match the repository configuration.

This is caused by a bug in the repository configuration validation.
fields.summary: WARN messages 'Repository index does not match the repository configuration' incorrectly logged after upgrading to 2.7
Activity / changelog shows only time on each row, not date+time making it difficult to understand when a changeset was added.  Add date to the time on each row

fields.description:
If you try to add content to a new review and select "Explore Repositories", a spinning icon is shown forever.

I'm using a brand-new test instance, with a very small repository (140 small commits) and 3 reviews created, so it's not a performance problem.
This is reproducible in Internet Explorer 9, Firefox 5 and Chrome 14, so it's not browser related as well.

It works if you choose any other option ("Browse Changesets", "Search for Files", "Pre-Commit" or "Attachments").

Please see the images attached showing the problem.

Nothing is thrown in the logs, unfortunately.
fields.summary: Spinning icon shown forever when trying to add content to review via "Explore Repositories"
